;发行信息发行信息10.1002/wrcr.26013水资源研究10.1002/wrcr.26013 https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/wrcr.26013?af=R 发行信息59 3个 https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1029/2022WR033537?af=R Thu, 23 Feb 2023 00:00:00 -0800 2023-02-23T12:00:00-08:00 Wiley：水资源研究：目录2023 年 3 月 1 日，星期三 00:00:00 -0800 2023 年 3 月 1 日，星期三 00:00:00 -0800 10.1029/2022WR033537渗流速度对孔隙堵塞生长行为的影响及其对多孔介质中细粒运移过程中渗透率降低的影响水资源研究，第 59 卷，第 3 期，2023 年 3 月。摘要 流体流动驱动的细粒运移常常导致多孔介质中的孔隙堵塞，从而降低多孔介质的渗透率。堵塞会在各种实践中造成严重问题，例如油气藏的地层损坏、流体抽取或注入效率的降低、过滤膜中颗粒引起的污染，甚至是地质结构沉积物破坏的风险。然而，渗流速度对细粒引起的孔隙堵塞的空间增长模式的影响仍不清楚。本研究通过一系列柱实验和同步 X 射线计算机断层扫描成像，探讨了由流动驱动的细粒在多孔介质中的迁移和积累引起的孔隙堵塞生长行为以及相关的渗透率降低。特别是，X 射线图像分析捕获了细粒的空间分布，从而捕获了各种渗流速度下的同质或异质（局部）堵塞生长模式。我们的结果表明，渗流速度的增加增加了局部堵塞增长的可能性，这归因于沙粒对细粒的直接拦截。与均匀的堵塞增长相比，局部堵塞增长导致渗透性更快地降低。本研究提供了关于细粒分布和相关渗透率变化的控制良好的实验数据，从而深入了解细粒在多孔介质中引起的堵塞行为。

;Assessments of regional water and energy security over historical and future periods require hydrologic models that can accurately simulate reservoir operations. However, scare reservoir operation data limits the accuracy of current reservoir representations in simulating reservoir behaviors. Furthermore, the reliability of these representations under changing inflow regimes remains unclear, which makes their application for long future planning horizons questionable. In comparison, our newly extended reservoir operation scheme can be more adaptable to flow regime variations. Our study provides a practical framework for reservoir impact assessments and predictions with the ongoing development of satellite altimetry projects such as SWOT.

Abstract Avulsions change river courses and transport water and sediment to new channels impacting infrastructure, floodplain evolution, and ecosystems. Abrupt avulsion events (occurring over days to weeks) are potentially catastrophic to society and thus receive more attention than slow avulsions, which develop over decades to centuries and can be challenging to identify. Abstract Climate change and the predicted warmer temperatures and more extreme hydrological regimes could affect freshwater ecosystems and their energy pathways. To appreciate the complex spatial and temporal interactions of carbon cycling in flowing waters, ecosystem metabolism (gross primary production, GPP, and ecosystem respiration, ER) must be resolved at the scale of an entire river network. Here, we propose a meta‐ecosystem framework that couples light and temperature regimes with a reach‐scale ecosystem model, and integrates network structure, catchment land cover and the hydrologic regime. The model simulates the distributed functioning of dissolved and particulate organic carbon, autotrophic biomass, and thus ecosystem metabolism, and reproduces fairly well the metabolic regimes observed in 12 reaches of the Ybbs river network, Austria. Abstract Gated storm surge barriers have been constructed or proposed in many estuaries worldwide for coastal flood risk reduction. Past studies have shown that, even when open, a barrier system's fixed infrastructure can increase estuary stratification and salt intrusion, potentially affecting water quality and ecological processes. However, surge barrier closures could have a much stronger influence on estuary conditions by temporarily blocking the tidal exchange. Across a range of modeled scenarios of gate closure frequencies, durations and river streamflows, we evaluate the changes caused by gate closures, as well as the recovery time to normal conditions. Our results for the Hudson show long‐duration gate closures (three or more days) with low streamflows temporarily lead to salt intrusion and stratification beyond recent historical extremes.
